item.title: Metaphor: ReFantazio Voice Cast Revealed
item.description:
Highlights

  • Metaphor: ReFantazio features a diverse voice cast with 11 actors, including party members and election candidates.
  • Studio Zero, led by Katsura Hashino, is developing the game to have its own identity separate from Persona.
  • The English voice cast has been confirmed, but the Japanese version faced setbacks, with one actor having to be recast.

Atlus revealed the voice cast for the characters in Metaphor: ReFantazio . Eleven voice actors have been introduced, covering both party members, traveling companions, and election candidates. Unlike Persona , Metaphor: ReFantazio won't feature a silent protagonist, whose voice actor has also been revealed.

Metaphor: ReFantazio is being developed by Studio Zero, a subsidiary of Atlus dedicated to creating new IPs beyond Shin Megami Tensei and Persona . The division is led by Katsura Hashino, the director and producer of several Persona titles and the director of Metaphor: ReFantazio . Because of that, comparisons between Metaphor: ReFantazio and Persona have been constant, but Hashino assures that the upcoming RPG will have its own distinct identity and personality.

Recently, Atlus unveiled the voice cast for Metaphor: ReFantazio . The game's protagonist will be voiced by Caleb Yen ( Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth ). The cast also includes Alejandra Reynoso ( Castlevania TV series) as Gallica, Stewart Clarke ( Final Fantasy 16 ) as Strohl, Kristin Atherton ( Banishers: Ghosts of New Eden ) as Hulkenberg, and Phillipe Spall ( Amnesia: The Bunker ) as Heismay. These are the five party members confirmed so far in the game. Atlus has said there will be seven party members in total, which increases the potential for archetypes in Metaphor: ReFantazio .

Metaphor: ReFantazio Cast List

  • Protagonist (Caleb Yen)
  • Strohl (Stewart Clarke)
  • Hulkenberg (Kristin Atherton)
  • Gallica (Alejandra Reynoso)
  • Heismay (Phillipe Spall)
  • Junah (Emma Ballantine)
  • Eupha (Emily Burnett)
  • Neuras (David Monteith)
  • Louis (Joseph Tweedale)
  • More (Greg Chun)
  • Grius (Gordon Cooper)

The rest of the voice actors listed include Emma Ballantine ( Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree ) as Junah, Emily Burnett ( Doctor Who: The Lonely Assassins ) as Eupha, David Monteith ( Baldur's Gate 3 ) as Neuras, Joseph Tweedale ( Assassin's Creed Valhalla ) as Louis, Greg Chun ( Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance ) as More, and Gordon Cooper ( Rise of the Ronin ) as Grius. These characters are a mix of the election candidates in Metaphor: ReFantazio and the protagonist's traveling companions.

In the same announcement that revealed the voice cast, Atlus confirmed that Metaphor: ReFantazio will be part of Xbox @ Gamescom 2024, featuring an interview with the voice actors and showcasing new content at the event in a playable Metaphor: ReFantazio demo. The interview will include Stewart Clarke and Kristin Atherton, who voice Strohl and Hulkenberg. The actors will offer insight into the recording process and answer questions about the RPG.

While the English voice cast has been confirmed, the Japanese version has faced some setbacks. In June this year, Atlus announced that it had recast voice actor Toru Furuya following abuse allegations. The character Furuya was set to voice in Metaphor: ReFantazio hadn't been revealed before his dismissal, but the veteran's resume includes iconic roles such as Seiya from Knights of the Zodiac , Yamcha from Dragon Ball , and Amuro Ray from the Gundam series. Atlus has yet to reveal the complete Japanese voice cast for Metaphor: ReFantazio .

item.title: Destiny 2 Weekly Reset: New Nightfall, Challenges, and Rewards
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers
  • Episode: Echoes Seasonal Challenges
  • Exotic Mission Rotation
  • Raid and Dungeon Rotation
  • Raid Challenges
  • Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit
  • Legacy Activities and Challenges
  • Dares of Eternity Rotation
  • Xur Details
  • Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Updated August 20, 2024: Another week has come for Destiny 2 , which means missions, challenges, and rewards have been reset. The final week of Destiny 2 's Solstice event has arrived, giving players one final change to collect silver leaves and forge the alloy needed to craft this year's unique armor sets. It also represents the final week before Act 3 of Episode Echoes arrives in full, begining the final art of this first episode.

Today's reset also brings about a brand-new update, which Bungie teased a little bit last week. One of the biggest changes with the update is that Xur will now carry Destiny 2 's exotic class items. While they'll be available starting on August 23, each week after that is subject to RNG, so they won't always be available each weekend. It's also worth noting that players will need to finish the Dual Destiny mission once in order for these randomized rolls to appear at Xur at all, otherwise they'll be replaced by an Exotic Cipher.

In the meantime, the Destiny 2 weekly reset continues right along with its usual refreshed content, activities, and rewards for players to chase over the next week. For a complete look at all the new content available for the week of August 20, including Nightfalls, Crucible modes, and challenges, here is everything players need to know.

Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers

Nightfall Strike : Exodus Crash

Advanced Modifiers:

  • Champions : Overload and Barrier
  • Hero Modifiers: Extra Shields. Void, Solar, and Arc.
  • Galvanized : Combatants have more health and are more difficult to stun.
  • Overcharge : Rocket Launcher and Kinetic Weapons when the player's subclass matches an active Surge element.
  • Arach-NO! : When defeated, Fallen Vandals spawn a web mine at their feet.
  • Threat : Arc
  • Surge : Void and Arc

Expert Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Equipment Locked : Unable to change equipment once the mission starts.

Master Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Master Modifiers : Locked Loadout, Extra Champions, and Extra Shields.

Grandmaster Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Chaff : Radar is disabled.
  • Master Modifiers : Extinguish, Limited Revives, Contest, and Join In Progress Disabled.

_______________________________________________________________

  • Nightfall Weapon : Scintillation (Adept Linear Fusion Rifle)

Episode: Echoes Seasonal Challenges

Week 12

  1. Moon Activities : On the Moon, earn progress by completing bounties, patrols, public events, and Lost Sectors.
  2. Blistered Fingers : Rapidly defeat 20 Vex in Gambit or Vanguard Ops activities.
  3. Orchestral Performance : Get 150 final blows with Heavy Ammo in Gambit, Crucible, or Vanguard Ops activities. Earn bonus progress for Sword final blows.
  4. Flourish of Power : Defeat 25 Guardians in the Mayhem playlist with Super abilities.
  5. Calibrate Long Range : Calibrate long-range weapons-Pulse Rifles, Bows, and Trace Rifles. Bonus progress for defeating Guardians.

Exotic Mission Rotation

Bungie brought back various exotic missions for players to run through to earn new rewards, gear, as well as craftable versions of exotic weapons. Like the Raid and Dungeon rotator, this one changes on a weekly basis.

Featured Exotic Mission : Operation: Seraph Shield (Revision Zero Exotic Pulse Rifle)

Raid and Dungeon Rotation

Originally introduced during Season 17, Bungie features Raids and Dungeons in a weekly rotation to make them farmable with updated rewards.

  • Featured Raid : Vault of Glass
  • Featured Dungeon : Prophecy

Raid Challenges

  • Salvation's Edge : Balanced Diet
  • Deep Stone Crypt : Red Rover
  • Vow of the Disciple : Defenses Down
  • Vault of Glass : The Only Oracle for You, Out of Its Way, Strangers In Time, Ensemble's Refrain, Wait For It...
  • King's Fall : The Grass is Always Greener
  • Root of Nightmares : Crossfire
  • Garden of Salvation : To The Top
  • Last Wish : Summoning Ritual

Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit

Players can earn additional rewards through Destiny 2 's Pathfinder system simply by playing and performing certain tasks in ritual activities like Vanguard Strikes, Crucible, and Gambit.

  • Weekly Crucible Modes : Mayhem, Countdown, Rumble
  • Gambit

Legacy Activities and Challenges

Europa

  • Exo Challenge : Simulation: Agility
  • Eclipsed Zone : Asterion Abyss
  • Empire Hunt : Phylaks: The Warrior

Neomuna

  • Incursion Zone : Ahimsa Park
  • Campaign Mission : Breakneck
  • Partition: Ordinance

Throne World

  • Weekly Story Mission : The Last Chance.
  • Altars of Reflection : Weekly activity that players can take on through specifically marked icons within the Throne World. These missions typically involve light puzzle solving as well as battling enemy combatants.

The Moon

  • Trove Guardian: Anchor of Light
  • Wandering Nightmare: Fallen Council (Archer's Line)
  • Campaign : A Mysterious Disturbance

Nightmare Rotation:

  • Taniks (Isolation)
  • Skolas (Pride)
  • Zydron (Servitude)

Dreaming City

  • The Dreaming City Curse Level : Rising - The Oracle Engine mission
  • Petra Venj Location : Divalian Mists
  • The Blind Well : Hive enemies - Plague: Cragur
  • Ascendant Challenge : Cimmerian Garrison (Chamber of Starlight).

Dares of Eternity Rotation

  • Round 1 : Taken
  • Round 2 : Cabal
  • Final Round : Zydron

Xur Details

Xur, the exotic merchant of Destiny 2 , arrives every weekend until reset, giving players a short window to check out what he has in stock. With The Final Shape, Xur has seen a rework of what is on offer. Here's what the merchant has for the weekend of 8/9:

  • Sunbracers (Warlock gauntlets)
  • Mechaneer's Tricksleeves (Hunter gauntlets)
  • Heart of Inmost Light (Titan chest armor)
  • Lord of Wolves (Shotgun)
  • The Huckleberry (SMG)
  • Thunderlord (Machine Gun)
  • Hawkmoon (Hand Cannon)
  • MIDA Multi-Tool Catalyst
  • Lumina Catalyst
  • Exotic Engram
  • Upgrade Module
  • Glimmer
  • Ascendant Alloy
  • Enhancement Cores
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)
  • Extraordinary Rendition (Kinetic Submachine Gun)
  • Cold Denial (Kinetic Pulse Rifle)
  • Cartesian Coordinate (Energy Fusion Rifle)
  • Hollow Words (Energy Auto Rifles)
  • Temptation's Hook (Heavy Sword)
  • Steel Sybil Z-14 (Heavy Sword)
  • Crown-Splitter/Quickfang/Eternity's Edge (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram
  • Midnight Exigent/Yuga Sundown/Abhorrent Imperative Armor Set

Make sure to check back every Friday for a comprehensive breakdown of all the new exotic gear and rolls that Xur brings to Destiny 2 .

Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Saint-14 and the Trails of Osiris offer players a high-end PvP activity in exchange for powerful rewards, especially for players who go flawless and earn a trip to the Lighthouse. Similar to most vendors in Destiny 2 , Saint-14 has a reputation system that rewards players for ranking up through playing and completing bounties.

Trials of Osiris for 8/16:

  • Map : Dissonance
  • Weapon : Aisha's Care (Adept Pulse Rifle)

item.title: Sony Might be Working on a Touchscreen Controller for the PlayStation 5
item.description:
Highlights

  • A new patent filed by Sony shows a PlayStation 5 controller with a touchscreen, allowing for customizable button layouts.
  • Buttons on the controller can be any size the user wishes and can be placed in any arrangement.
  • While not guaranteed, Sony's new touchscreen controller could make gaming even more accessible.

According to a new patent, Sony might be working on a new PlayStation 5 controller that uses a touchscreen instead of buttons. Gaming is an ever-evolving landscape, and Sony has filed numerous patents for new peripherals or features that might be used in a future PlayStation console. Some of these are software-based, like a feature that could convert captured gameplay footage into replayable minigames or a system to let players take voice or video calls in-game.

Other Sony patents hint at new controllers or hardware features, like a DualSense with special earbud slots or a detachable touchscreen peripheral for gaming away from the TV. There have also been patents for spherical PlayStation controllers that could be used in VR games and gamepads that could change temperature to simulate in-game environments. While the existing PlayStation 5 DualSense already creates an immersive experience for gamers and the PlayStation Access controller includes a wealth of accessibility options, it seems that Sony is constantly looking for new ways to improve player input in games.

Earlier this month, another Sony controller patent was published detailing a new touchscreen-based design. The face of this controller would be one giant touchscreen into which players could program as many buttons as they need. Said buttons can be any size the user wishes and can be placed in any arrangement the player might see fit, such as lowering the directional pad or moving the X button to the right. This would result in a truly customizable controller layout tailored to each users needs or preferences.

New Sony Patent Describes Customizable Touchscreen Controller

The controllers for the PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 already incorporate touchpads that allow for feel-based inputs, but they are nowhere near as advanced as the touchscreen described in this recent Sony patent. As mentioned before, Sony has previously toyed with the idea of a touchscreen peripheral for the PlayStation 5 DualSense, and the PlayStation Portal remote controller uses a touchpad for video display in the place of a standard monitor or TV.

While these options are used in tandem with the traditional PlayStation controller buttons, this new Sony patent would theoretically replace them with a fully customizable touchscreen display that would be programmed to fit an individuals playstyle. Of course, as with all patents, there is no guarantee that Sonys new touchscreen controller idea will ever be realized, but if it someday comes to fruition, it could give gamers a whole new means of input for their favorite PlayStation 5 titles.

item.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard Confirms New Weapons for Mages
item.description:
Highlights

  • Enjoy new weapon choices for Mages in Dragon Age: The Veilguard, with daggers and orbs now available along with the staff.
  • Fast-paced, action-focused gameplay in The Veilguard offers control only of your own character, departing from previous titles.

Instead of limiting Mages to an elemental staff, Dragon Age: The Veilguard will also allow alternative weapon choices for its spellcaster class, such as the dagger and orb. Much discussion has been made about the combat in Dragon Age: The Veilguard , as its approach represents a major departure from previous Dragon Age titles. While strategy, skill progression, and party management exist, the gameplay itself is fast-paced, action-focused, and allows players to only control their own character.

The release date for Dragon Age: The Veilguard was revealed with a new trailer, and fans can expect to see plenty of new gameplay footage until the end of August 2024. Whereas its deep dive in June 2024 showcased the opening hours of the game, BioWare is eager to present high-level content for all three classes from August 19 to August 26.

Related
What Are Your Thoughts On Dragon Age: Veilguard's New Combat System?

I've been a fan of Dragon Age since Origins, and while I'm a little disappointed that it won't have the classic turn-based tactical combat, I'm not entirely opposed to the action-combat system shown in trailers. It reminds me of Mass Effect, in a way, and I can only hope that it's as satisfying as it looks.

Even within the same class in Dragon Age: The Veilguard , fans can expect to have plenty of different playstyles made available to them. Mike Gamble commented on a recent video of Dragon Age: The Veilguard , stating that players would be able to wield a dagger and orb as a Mage, and thus not be beholden to the iconic staff. Given that the Spellblade, a Mage specialization associated with the Antivan Crows, will feature in The Veilguard , it's quite possible that Mages will have an even wider arsenal of weapons to choose from.

Dragon Age: The Veilguard Mage Specializations

  • Death Caller Mourn Watch
  • Spellblade Antivan Crows
  • Evoker Shadow Dragons

Though not directly confirmed, it's assumed that the choice of origin for Rook in Dragon Age: The Veilguard will dictate the specializations that are initially available for the player. The rest of the specializations will instead be learned by engaging with the major factions of Northern Thedas, such as the Lords of Fortune and the Shadow Dragons. A fair few of them will have exclusive weapons, such as the Reaper (tied to the Mourn Watch faction), which will use night blades instead of the more traditional Warrior options.

Much like previous titles, the companions in Dragon Age: The Veilguard will have their own specializations, and will be tied to the faction to which they belong to. For example, Neve Gallus is an Ice Mage, a unique version of the Evoker specialization, which is exclusively obtained from the Shadow Dragons. While players won't be able to control them directly, the combat in The Veilguard will encourage teamwork between the companions and Rook, as many of the abilities will support devastating combos. Dragon Age: The Veilguard is set to launch on October 31, 2024, nearly a decade after its predecessor.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14 Reveals 11th Anniversary Event And Rewards
item.description:
Highlights

  • The 2024 edition of The Rising in Final Fantasy 14 runs from August 27 to September 11.
  • Players will be able to earn the Brushed-up Krile minion and Rising Table Lamp indoor housing item as rewards.
  • Past Rising items may be available for purchase on the Final Fantasy 14 Online Store during the event.

With its 11th anniversary right around the corner, Final Fantasy 14 revealed what players can expect during the 2024 edition of the Rising event. Starting next week, Final Fantasy 14 players will have a new quest to undertake that will grant them a new minion and indoor housing item after completing it.

Held in late August each year, The Rising is a commemoration of Final Fantasy 14 's relaunch as A Realm Reborn . Following the game's disastrous 1.0 release, Final Fantasy 14 producer and director Naoki Yoshida decided to build an entirely new game from scratch, which became A Realm Reborn in 2013. In the game's lore, the shutdown of Final Fantasy 14 version 1.0 was heralded by the Seventh Umbral Calamity, which saw Bahamut lay waste to Eorzea, only for the land to rise from the ashes like the mythical Phoenix. In the 2023 iteration of The Rising, Final Fantasy 14 players could earn a Rising Phoenix mount.

One day after the ongoing Moonfire Faire concludes, Final Fantasy 14 will keep the party going with its upcoming anniversary. According to Square Enix, the annual Rising event will start on Tuesday, August 27, at 3:00 AM Eastern, and conclude on Wednesday, September 11, at 10:59 AM Eastern. Unlike past years, which saw the Rising held in the desert city of Ul'dah, this year's festivities will be in a different capital city. The seasonal quest "Rising to the Call" can be started by players with any level 15 class or Job by speaking to the Wandering Minstrel in the Upper Decks of Limsa Lominsa. The minstrel can be found in the Aftcastle in the center of the decks, seeking out adventurers willing to help lend a hand with The Rising celebrations.

Final Fantasy 14 Reveals 2024 Rising Event Details

  • The 2024 edition of The Rising runs from August 27 to September 11.
  • The Rising is Final Fantasy 14's anniversary event, made to commemorate the game's relaunch.
  • New rewards include the Brushed-up Krile minion and a Rising Table Lamp housing item.
  • Past Rising items may be put on sale on the Final Fantasy 14 Online Store.

The rewards that players can earn this year are the Rising Table Lamp, which is an indoor housing item, and the Brushed-up Krile minion. Although Krile has been depicted as a collectible minion in Final Fantasy 14 before, this exclusive Rising minion is the first to feature her as the Pictomancer Job that was introduced in Dawntrail . Past rewards from The Rising, including the 2023 Rising Phoenix reward, will likely go on sale on the Final Fantasy 14 Online Store once this year's Rising event kicks off.

It remains to be seen how much the Rising Phoenix and other rewards will cost. But, between the annual Rising event, and in-person events at Gamescom and PAX West, Final Fantasy 14 players will have plenty to celebrate as summer winds down.
